etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 力(力) (lì, "strength") = forceful or authoritative mouth -> something different or other
etymology.interpretation: The character 另(lìng, "other") combines the semantic element of 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") with the phonetic and semantic element 力(力) (lì, "strength") to convey a sense of adding something distinct or different through forceful speech.

examples.chinese: 我准备了另一本书(我準備了另一本書)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhǔnbèi le lìng yī běn shū.

examples.chinese: 他不满意当前方案(他不滿意當前方案)，所以提出了另一个改进措施(所以提出了另一個改進措施)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù mǎnyì dāngqián fāng'àn, suǒyǐ tíchūle lìng yīgè gǎijìn cuòshī.
examples.english: He was dissatisfied with the current plan, so he proposed an alternative improvement measure.
